intro: Pleuteron siliquosa, commonly known as the slender silique, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated pods known as siliques, which contain the seeds. Its flowers are small and typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Pleuteron siliquosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
